page.title: 13The Miners' Strike
page.content: In March 1984 there was a strike. People all over Great Britain were affected, families split up and left the area.Businesses went bankrupt, shopkeepers had to shut down. In the winter it was cold. They had no coal. At Christmas the miner's children were given second hand clothes and toys.The children were always hungry. Their mothers could not afford to feed them. People sent money for them but it could not help much.They were given food parcels at least. Wives opened up soup kitcens for the men. Over the holidays schools put meals on for the miners' children. I thought that this was very kind.
